newsitem.title: UK: Record producer Immediate considers AIM listing.
newsitem.headline: Record producer Immediate considers AIM listing.

text.p: Independent record company Immediate Entertainment Group Inc said on Monday it was considering a float on the London Stock Exchange's Alternative Investment Market (AIM) and pledged to liven up the music market.
The group said it intended to list on NASDAQ in August and is also preparing to raise $5 million via a private placing.
The proposed placing is being handled by German investment bank Falken Vermogensberatung and the group said the proceeds would be used to fund acquisitions.
Immediate is headed by Tony Calder, a former DJ and pop manager, who said he planned to sign new bands and put fresh energy into the music market.
"We are close to getting some sensational acts," Calder told Reuters. "Of course you need to market bands well but you must create demand and that is what we intend to do."
Calder, in partnership with former Rolling Stones manager Andrew Oldham, set up Immediate Records in 1965 and helped to develop acts such as Fleetwood Mac, Rod Stewart and The Small Faces.
Immediate, which operates in a number of countries, has developed into an integrated record company with studios, CD plant and in-house marketing, sales and distribution systems.
The group's shares started trading on the OTC bulletin board in the United States in October 1996 at $3 and are currently trading around $4.
The record company is also considering a flotation on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange as an alternative to AIM.
